locsearch.runner package¶

Submodules¶

locsearch.runner.abstract_runner module¶

class locsearch.runner.abstract_runner.AbstractRunner¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Template to create runners.

Runners are responsible for initializing and running an algorithm. I/O and, when needed, plotting data. Implementation can be easily done by inheriting from this class and implementing tha abstract methods. Use instance variables for data that needs to be remembered for use in other methods.

results¶

The results from the execution of the algorithm.

Type:collections.namedtuple
define_algorithm()¶

Creating and initialising an AbstractLocalSearch instance.

define_evaluation_function()¶

Creating and initialising an evaluation function.

define_move_function()¶

Creating and initialising a move function.

define_solution()¶

Creating and initialising a solution object.

define_termination_criterion()¶

Creating and initialising a termination criterion, if needed.

This function does not always need to be implemented.

output()¶

Handles the output.

read(path)¶

Reads a file.

Parameters:path (str) – The relative or absolute path to the file.
run(path)¶

initializes and runs an instance of an AbstractLocalSearch class.

Parameters:path (str) – The relative or absolute path to the file.
run_algorithm()¶

Starts running the algorithm.

Returns:results – The results.
Return type:collections.namedtuple

locsearch.runner.simulated_annealing_runner module¶

class locsearch.runner.simulated_annealing_runner.SimulatedAnnealingRunner¶

Bases: locsearch.runner.abstract_runner.AbstractRunner

Loads a problem and performs simulated annealing on the problem.

Note that the default implementation only works with tsp problems from tsplib.

_data¶

The data read from a file.

_distance_matrix¶

The distance matrix for the problem.

Type:numpy.ndarray
_size¶

The amount of points in the tsp problem.

Type:int
_move_function¶

The move function that needs to be used.

Type:AbstractMove
_evaluation_function¶

The evaluation function used for the problem.

Type:AbstractEvaluationFunction
_solution¶

The solution object for the problem.

Type:AbstractLocalSearchSolution
_termination_criterion¶

The termination criterion for the algorithm.

Type:AbstractTerminationCriterion
_cooling_func¶

The cooling function for the algorithm.

Type:AbstractCoolingFunction
_i_for_temp¶

The amount of iterations for temperature function for the algorithm.

Type:AbstrIterationsTempFunction
_algorithm¶

The steepest descent algorithm used.

Type:SteepestDescent
results¶

The results from the localsearch.

Examples

Using the runner:

from locsearch.runner.simulated_annealing_runner \
    import SimulatedAnnealingRunner
runner = SimulatedAnnealingRunner()
runner.run(path_to_file)
define_algorithm()¶

Creating and initialising a steepest descent algorithm.

define_cooling_function()¶

Creating and initialising a cooling function

define_evaluation_function()¶

Creating and initialising an evaluation function.

define_iteration_temp_f()¶

Create and init an amount of iterations for temperature function.

define_move_function()¶

Creating and initialising a move function.

Creating and initialising the solution object.

Parameters:path (str) – The relative or absolute path to the file.

locsearch.runner.steepest_descent_runner module¶

class locsearch.runner.steepest_descent_runner.SteepestDescentRunner¶

Bases: locsearch.runner.abstract_runner.AbstractRunner

Loads a problem and performs a steepestdescent on said problem.

Note that the default implementation only works with tsp problems from tsplib.

_data¶

The data read from a file.

_distance_matrix¶

The distance matrix for the problem.

Type:numpy.ndarray
_size¶

The amount of points in the tsp problem.

Type:int
_move_function¶

The move function that needs to be used.

Type:AbstractMove
_evaluation_function¶

The evaluation function used for the problem.

Type:AbstractEvaluationFunction
_solution¶

The solution object for the problem.

Type:AbstractLocalSearchSolution
_algorithm¶

The steepest descent algorithm used.

Type:SteepestDescent
results¶

The results from the localsearch.

Examples

Using the runner:

from locsearch.runner.steepest_descent_runner \
    import SteepestDescentRunner
runner = SteepestDescentRunner()
runner.run(path_to_file)
